data.title: Chameleon at rest
data.meta_description: Commemorating a populist with shades of truth and memory | News
data.text: “OF COURSE I knew Mr Haider personally!” says Mr Berger, taking a break from his singing. He had been accompanying a melancholy Alpine choir at the opening of a museum commemorating Jörg Haider, an Austrian far-right politician who died in a drunken car crash on October 11th 2008.
